title: ‘The King’ Hair: How Timothée Chalamet and Robert Pattinson’s Looks Were Made
text:
Netflix’s new Shakespearean drama The King tells the story of an unwilling Henry V, played by Timothée Chalamet, who goes to war against a villainous French Dauphin (Robert Pattinson). While royal infighting and a muddy battle occupy much of the movie, another war rages in real life: who had the better hair?

Was it Chalamet, of whose circular chop co-star Joel Edgerton joked, “We put a breakfast bowl on his head and just went for it”? Or Pattinson, whose long, Elizabethan-surfer locks delighted fans more accustomed to his...
